alert.note: Alert for South Washington Coast (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 12 at 1:24PM PST until February 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON MONDAY TO 4 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Large waves and hazardous surf conditions. Breakers of 20 to 25 feet. * WHERE...South Washington Coast. * WHEN...From noon Monday to 4 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Destructive waves may wash over beaches, jetties, and other structures unexpectedly. People can be swept off rocks and jetties and drown while observing high surf. Minor beach erosion may damage coastal properties and buildings. Higher than normal water run-up is expected on beaches and low-lying shoreline.
info.instruction: A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches, producing rip currents, sneaker waves and beach erosion. Stay well back from the water`s edge and be alert for exceptionally high waves. Keep away from large logs on the beach. Water running up on the beach can easily lift or roll logs which can injure or kill someone caught in their path.
